causes: High taxes and trade restrictions imposed by the Teutonic Order on Prussian cities.
Growing economic power of Hanseatic League cities clashing with feudal control.
Discontent among urban elites, who wanted more autonomy from the Order.
events_leading_up_to_war: Hanseatic merchants in Prussia demanded lower tariffs, which the Teutonic Order refused.
Prussian cities formed the Prussian Confederation in defiance of Teutonic rule.
Armed skirmishes and embargoes escalated into open rebellion.

result.treaty: Cities forced to accept Teutonic control but gained trade concessions.
result.territorial_changes: Teutonic Order maintained control over Prussia, but trade regulations were loosened.

major_battles.name: Siege of Danzig
major_battles.description: Teutonic forces besieged Danzig (modern Gdańsk), forcing its surrender after several months.

major_battles.name: Naval Battle of the Vistula Estuary
major_battles.description: Hanseatic warships clashed with Teutonic coastal defenses; the Order repelled the attack.

texts.name: Teutonic Order Financial Records
texts.details: Lists of war expenses, mercenary payments, and city fines.

texts.name: Hanseatic Merchant Letters
texts.details: Letters discussing trade restrictions and war preparations.

archaeological_evidence.description: Ruins of fortifications in Danzig showing cannon damage.
Hanseatic League trade ships sunk during naval engagements.

political: Cities remained under Teutonic control but won greater trade rights.
Hanseatic League continued challenging feudal rulers in later conflicts.
long_term_effects: Weakened the Teutonic Order’s grip on urban economies.
Set the stage for the Prussian Confederation’s later revolt in 1454, leading to Poland’s intervention.

military: Showed the power of merchant militias and private fleets against knightly orders.
Highlighted the effectiveness of economic warfare (embargoes, trade blockades).
political: Marked a turning point where trade-based coalitions challenged military rulers.
Set a precedent for future merchant city revolts in the Holy Roman Empire.
cultural: Strengthened Hanseatic League unity against feudal control.
Helped develop the identity of Prussian cities as semi-independent trading hubs.
